TextAsset.value: (Hmm, Al said he’d be up here…)
(Maybe I missed him.)
(Unless he’s in disguise!)
(As a, uh, hmm. One of those twirly roof vent things?)
${slot:playerName}.
(Or I was a little early.)
I thought you’d be here.
You told me to meet you here, so yeah.
You always do what you’re told?
Sometimes I never do what I’m told.
Some other times, I always do.
(Yeah, way to sound mysterious, ${slot:playerName}!)
(That makes you all kinds of alluring.)
You’re quite a mystery, ${slot:playerName}.
(Ha! I knew it!)
I brought you up here for a reason.
(Probably for his criminal justice club.)
(Ooh, maybe we’re doing a stakeout!)
I wanted you to meet a “friend” of mine.
(Whoa, introducing me to his friends already?)
(Things are moving so fast!)
Only problem is…
...SHE’S A CRIMINAL!
Oh no! And you’re in the criminal justice club!
SO CONFLICTED!
(Being conflicted is a very romantic and grown up thing to do.)
(It’s like Al is a film noir protagonist!)
(I guess! Dunno, film studies is more like a college thing after all.)
(But it sounds good!)
So, when you meet, you’ll have to give her the secret criminal handshake or she won’t trust you.
(Wow, I was right the first time.)
(This is so a stakeout!)
I brought you up here so you could show me the handshake in private.
Where no one else in school would see it and then enter the world of crime.
The secret criminal handshake...
(How am I supposed to show Al how to do a thing I don’t even know?!)
Um. Sure.
It goes like…
(Uh, ummmmmmm. Just make it up! Here goes nothing.)
You start by going up.
And then, um. Further up.
That’s the key to it. So you know something is “UP.” Like the jig maybe. That’s criminal talk.
And then, uh, because you’re so high up now, you have to bring it back down.
(Can’t believe I’m holding hands with Al already!)
(I guess technically we’re not REALLY holding hands…)
(But technically we are too!)
(Um. Where was I with the handshake?)
(Oh, right!)
Uh, yeah. So, then you take it down a notch.
Down again?
Uh, sure. Yeah.
(Did I do two downs by accident? Oh, whatever!)
And then you sort of go to the left with it.
Uh, and then back right.
Because if you kept going left it’d look a little weird.
But then you do it again so they know it wasn’t a fluke.
What, left and right twice then?
Uh…?
Yeah.
(I guess!)
And then you finish it up by going “Big Another Start.”
And, like, normal people will just think it’s nonsense. But another criminal would know what you meant was the same words only reversed.
“Start Another Big.”
And the response they give to that is “Crime.”
And THAT is your criminal code.
(Hey, that sounded pretty good!)
(Boy, Al sure is taking a lot of notes.)
Even the handshake of crime is devious!
(I will just assume I randomly guessed it completely right!)
(WHAT WERE THE ODDS!)
I think you’re ready to meet my “friend.”
Let’s go to the secret criminal meeting place.
(Skipping school AND leaving school grounds?!)
(This is truly dangerous stuff we’re up to.)
Are we stopping for a latte?
This is the secret criminal hangout spot.
It’s why we hold all the criminal justice club meetings here.
(That makes sense.)
(In a way…?)
I’ll introduce you to my “friend.”
You’ll give her the criminal code handshake.
And then you guys just...talk.
Freely and as if no one is recording you for evidence.
(Ha! That’s easy. I talk like that all the time!)
Here she is.
${slot:playerName}. Meet Codename Condor.
(Sheesh, and I thought Galaga Ship was a dumb name.)
You know that’s not my name, AL.
I MEAN CONNIE!
Hrm.
Anyway. Hello, ${slot:playerName}.
Pleased to meet you.
(Wait! Maybe I shouldn’t be so polite.)
(Are criminals polite to one another as a matter of course?)
(Honor among thieves, that’s totally a saying, right?)
(Maybe that extends to basic manners too?)
I’ll just leave you two alone. I’m sure you and Codename Connie have a lot to talk about.
It’s JUST Connie, ALFONSO.
Right. Yes. Sorry.
My friend. Connie.
Thank you.
We can speak without reservation now that Al left us alone and is not hiding with remote listening devices to pick up on criminal activity.
(Ha! She doesn’t suspect a thing!)
${slot:playerName}, I’m just a fellow student of your Namco High.
Really? I haven’t seen you in class...
Because er, ah, I skip…
EVERY CLASS!
(Whoa! Connie must be one of those troublemakers!)
(And that’s why she has all those aliases!)
(And since Al’s club is all about stopping troublemakers…)
(I bet he’s gonna take her down!)
(And he’s brought me along for back up!)
(Wow!)
(Better play it cool.)
Yeah? That’s no big deal.
I skip classes I don’t even have.
Wow. Hard core. I figured we would have a lot in common.
Therefore, I feel very comfortable talking with you about...
CHEAT CODES!
(Ah-ha! Now I get it!)
(Al wants me to play the part of a cheat code dealer.)
(And then we’ll catch Connie in the act of trying to trade cheat codes with me.)
(And then we’ll have her arrested and make the club look really productive!)
(Wow, this is so high-stakes! Al must really trust and like me.)
Uh, yeah.
Cheat codes.
I totally know so much about those.
Good.
Knowing about those is what I was hoping to hear.
But let’s do the criminal code handshake before we get down to business.
(I don’t remember what I did for the handshake at all!)
Um.
No.
No?
Hahaha!
${slot:playerName}, you passed the final criminal code test.
USING RUDENESS!
(I KNEW IT!!!)
Okay, then. My gang could use some cheat codes.
(SHE’S IN A GANG?????)
(This is serious business!)
And then we would use the cheat codes like weapons against other gangs and maybe the police.
Because we’re bad.
(You said it, lady!)
(No wonder Al wants to put her behind bars.)
Therefore as a plausible result of the things I just said, I’d be willing to pay top coin for cheat codes.
For my criminal gang.
If someone knew where to get them, that is.
(It’s all on me now!)
(Gosh, this is such a cool club.)
(And Al’s such a cool guy. And he’s really into me and oh crud.)
(Need to keep my head in the game!)
(Ahem.)
Yeah. Cheat codes. Sure.
I’ve heard of those and know how they work.
Yes. Good. I’d like some.
Um. Bad ones.
Well, I mean, GOOD ones. Like, they should work.
But you’d only use them if you’re a bad person trying to get away with a big ol’ crime is what I’m saying.
(Like MURDER?!?!)
Like ripping the tag off a mattress.
Oh.
Or something bigger.
Like...embezzling pensions.
Or committing mail fraud.

Or “retiring” from a high paying corporate position only to receive a hefty “consultation” fee from the same firm in perpetuity while courting the very politicians who determine the policy that regulates the same industry you used to blah blah blah
(I’m not following any of this! But it sure sounds dangerous but also like something that’d be on the news probably?)
(Connie is the most mature criminal I’ve ever met!)
(Also the only one.)
Yeah, sure.
You want to equip your gang with the cheat codes.
So you can break the law some more.
I dig it, daddio.
(Is that even a criminal lingo???)
Then let’s deal some cheat codes with one another.
Yes. Let us.
Yes, I ordered the latte.
Thank you.
(Wait, what’s Principal Dig Dug doing here?!)
(An innocent life is caught in the middle of our criminal dealings!)
${slot:playerName}?
(Oh no!)
(Don’t panic, ${slot:playerName}!)
(Just use your criminal mind to construct a lie.)
(You can do this!)
Uh. Nope?
(Hm. That lie could’ve been a little more fleshed out I guess.)
This is the most flagrant instance of skipping I’ve seen in all my years of principal-ing!
You’re in for the deadliest detention of them all.
BATTLEDOME DETENTION!
(WHAT?!?!)
You probably haven’t heard of it because…
NO ONE HAS EVER SURVIVED ITS RIGORS!
Or been sent to it yet. It’s new.
You can’t do this to me!
(Oh, man. I hate to disappoint Al and blow the whole sting operation, but I can’t duel to the death. I like living too much!)
I’m here on official school club spirit building business!
I am suspicious but listening.
For the Namco Anti Real Crime club!
I’m doing a sting!
Sorry, Connie.
(What the--!!!)
(She’s already gone???)
Namco Anti Real Crime club, eh?
It’s a shame there isn’t a fiction club. Because you could be its president!
Well, vice president, because of Aki.
But the takeaway is that there is no such thing as a Namco Anti Real Crime club!
That’s crazy! Al B. Tross is in the club too.
You think piling lie on top of lie will make the original lie stick.
But it won’t work for one very simple but incredibly dramatic reason.
THERE HASN’T BEEN AN AL B. TROSS ENROLLED AT NAMCO HIGH FOR THIRTY YEARS!!!
(WAS AL A GHOST ALL ALONG?!?!?!)
Nor has there ever been an Al B. Tross enrolled at Namco High. Ever.
(So…)
(Wait, not a ghost? What?)
Yes, one of my hobbies is to memorize enrollment records.
You might think that’s crazy. Plenty do.
But I couldn’t have cracked the Case Of The ${slot:playerName} Who Lies About Clubs While Skipping Class without that knowledge!
(There’s clearly some kind of confusion here about attendance and record keeping practices. But that’s a mystery for another time.)
(Right now I JUST DON’T WANNA DO A BATTLEDOME!!!)
Uh, er. You can’t take me in for skipping class.
We’re off school grounds. You have no authority here!
(Ah-ha! The ol’ legal mumbo jumbo trick!)
That’s true…
(Whew!)
Off of school grounds, I have no legal right to invoke THE BATTLEDOME.
Despite my frequent lobbying to the contrary...
In light of these findings, I shall commute your sentence to a mere Double Detention.
